titleStmt.title: Edward P. Campbell to James F. Robinson
CWG8926

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons, Remissions, and Respites, 1862-1863

body.p:
Princeton Kentucky 16" July 1863
Gov Robinson
Frankfort Ky
Dr Sir

I have examined the Petition of Thomas W Pickring a citizen of Caldwell County,, in regard to a fine of ($500) assessed to him at the June Term 1863 of the Caldwell Circuit Court" for usurpation of office and find the statements made in his said Petition are true,, Pickring has heavy liabilities to meet as surrety for other parties and has a large family to support and his conduct has been that of an Orderly -- quiet citizen since his release from (Johnsons Island) my opinion is that he is now effectually cured and he is willing and anxious to obey all laws,,

I am Yours truly
E P,, Campbell
